name: The Great Attractor
the-point: Our entire galaxy is being pulled toward a mysterious point in space that we cannot see.

name: Diamond Rain
the-point: On Saturn and Jupiter, it literally rains diamonds.

name: Neutron Stars
the-point: A single teaspoon of a neutron star would weigh about 6 billion tons.

name: The Cold Weld
the-point: In a vacuum, two pieces of the same metal will permanently fuse together if they touch.

name: Silent Space
the-point: Space is completely silent because there is no air to carry sound waves.

name: The Multiverse
the-point: If the universe is infinite, there is another version of you reading this right now.

name: Black Holes
the-point: If you fell into a black hole, an outside observer would see you frozen in time forever.

name: Voyager Golden Record
the-point: We sent a gold record into space containing sounds of Earth, just in case aliens find it.

name: Sun’s Mass
the-point: The Sun makes up 99.8% of the total mass of our entire solar system.

name: Moon Drift
the-point: The Moon is moving away from Earth at a rate of about 1.5 inches per year.

name: Gold Origins
the-point: Every piece of gold on Earth was created during the collision of two dead stars.

name: Space Smells
the-point: Astronauts describe the smell of space as 'seared steak' or 'hot metal'.

name: Dark Matter
the-point: About 85% of the matter in the universe is 'dark matter' which we cannot see or touch.

name: Light Speed
the-point: If you traveled at light speed, time would essentially stop for you.

name: Footprints on Moon
the-point: Because there is no wind on the Moon, the Apollo footprints will likely stay there for millions of years.

name: The Boötes Void
the-point: There is a massive 'hole' in space that should have 10,000 galaxies but only has 60.

name: Star Death
the-point: When you look at stars, you are often looking at objects that have been dead for millions of years.

name: Planet Nine
the-point: Evidence suggests there is a 9th giant planet at the edge of our solar system we haven't found yet.

name: Venus Volcanoes
the-point: Venus has more volcanoes than any other planet in our solar system.

name: The Big Crunch
the-point: Will the universe expand forever, or will it eventually collapse back into a single point?

name: Space Junk
the-point: There are over 500,000 pieces of man-made debris orbiting Earth right now.

name: Uranus Tilt
the-point: Uranus is the only planet that rotates on its side, like a rolling ball.

name: Micro-gravity Health
the-point: Astronauts can grow up to 2 inches taller in space because their spines expand.

name: Galactic Collision
the-point: In 4 billion years, our galaxy will collide with the Andromeda galaxy.

name: The Fermi Paradox
the-point: If the universe is so big, why haven't we found any evidence of other civilizations yet?
